champ.champInfo:
General management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out by the Ministry of Youth and Sports of Ukraine (hereinafter - the Ministry of Youth Sports) and the NGO "National Kyokushinkai Karate Federation of Ukraine" (hereinafter - the Federation). The direct holding of the competition is entrusted to the Department of Physical Culture and Sports of the Lviv State Administration, the Non-governmental organization sports club kyokushinkai karate "KANKU", the Main Board of Judges, approved by the Federation. The chief judge of the competition is Shikhan Mutin Serhiy Askhatovych, 5th Dan (Lviv) international category A kyokushinkai karate sports judge.

The competition will be held on April 23, 2023 in Lviv, Ukraine.

Competition organizing committee: NGO "Kanku Kyokushinkai Karate Sports Club"

E-mail: kanku.lviv@gmail.com

Shikhan Mutin Serhii tel.: +38 067 674 49 11

Mutina Nataliya tel.: +38 097 609 30 10

Program

April 22, 2023

  • 11:00 a.m. – 6:00 p.m. team registration, mandate and medical commission, weighing of participants (Emily Sport Arena, address: Vinnyki, 96 Khmelnytsko St.

April 23, 2023

  • 07:00 – 08:00 weighing of newly arrived teams, meeting of the technical secretariat (Emily Sport Arena, address: Vinnyki, str.Khmelnytskyi 9b
  • 08:00 - 08:15 draw of competition participants
  • 08:15 – 08:45 judges' meeting of the GSK, formation of judges' teams
  • 09:00 - 11:30 competitions in the "kata" and "team kata" sections;
  • 11:45 – 11:55 line-up of participants for the entrance march, line-up of judges, team representatives, invited officials
  • 12:00 - 12:30 ceremonial opening of the competition
  • 12:30 - 14:00 qualifying competitions in the "kumite" section
  • 14:00 - 17:00 start of the final part of the competition in the "kumite" section
  • 17:00 – 18:00 end of the competition, awarding of winners and prize-winners, closing of the competition

Competition participants

Athletes born in 2003-2005, members of national kyokushinkai karate teams of Crimea, oblasts, cities of Kyiv and Sevastopol take part in the competition. Questions regarding the admission of athletes or teams from the Donetsk and Luhansk regions, the city of Sevastopol and the Autonomous Republic of Crimea to participate in competitions are decided by the panel of judges. Participants born in 2005 who will be 18 years old on the day of the European Championship (June 24-25, Debrecen, Hungary) are allowed to participate in the competition. Other participants of this year of birth will not be admitted to the competition! The participants of the competition must have a sports qualification not lower than the 3rd grade of the ECSU. Male and female participants compete in separate sections of the competition.

Juniors and juniors born in 2005-2006, members of national kyokushinkai karate teams of Crimea, oblasts, cities of Kyiv and Sevastopol take part in the competition.

Athletes born in 2007-2008, members of national kyokushinkai karate teams of Crimea, oblasts, cities of Kyiv and Sevastopol take part in the competition.

Tournament rules

Competitions are held in accordance with the "Kyokushinkai Karate Competition Rules" in force in Ukraine. Team qualifying is common for male and female participants. To determine the places of teams based on individual and team championships, the results of only those participants who are included in the qualifying teams will be taken into account. The standings of the teams are finally determined by the mandate committee. Team points are calculated according to the rules of kyokushinkai karate competitions in force in Ukraine

KUMITE categories

Men

  • 2003-2004(2005): -65; -70; -75; -80; -85; -90; +90
  • 2005-2006: -60; -65; -70; -75; -80; +80
  • 2007-2008: -50; -55; -60; -65; -70; -75; +75

Women

  • 2003-2004(2005): -50; -55; -60; -65; +65
  • 2005-2006: -50; -55; -60; -65; +65
  • 2007-2008: -50; -55; -60; -65; +65

Conducting matches and duration of matches.

  • 2003-2004(2005): 2.0 min.; 2.0 min.; 2.0 min
  • 2005-2006: 2.0 min.; 2.0 min.; 2.0 min
  • 2007-2008: 1.5 min.; 1.5 min.; 1.5 min

Holding of matches and duration of matches (men/women).

Please note that the weighing of athletes after the first draw extension is canceled due to the fact that the competition is a qualifier for the European Championship among boys and girls (June 24-25, Debrecen, Hungary) and is held according to the rules of the European Karate Organization (EKO )

Section "KATA" (individual competitions):

  • 2003-2004(2005)
    • Qualifying rounds: mandatory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Heksai-dai, Yantsu, Tsuki-no-kata, Saiha, Heksai-sho
    • Quarterfinals, semifinals 3rd place match, finals: personal choice kata with Seipai, Garyu, Seienchin, Kanku, Susi-ho
    • Personal choice kata in the quarter-finals, semi-finals, 3rd place match and final must be different
  • 2005-2006
    • Qualifying rounds: mandatory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu
    • Quarterfinals, Semifinals 3rd Place Match, Final: Personal Choice Kata from Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu, Saiha or Heksai-sho
    • Personal choice kata in the quarter-finals, semi-finals, 3rd place match and final must be different
  • 2007-2008
    • Qualifying rounds: mandatory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Pinan sono 2-5
    • Quarterfinals, Semifinals, 3rd Place Match, Final: Personal Choice Kata with Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu
    • Kata by personal choice should be different

"TEAM KATA" section:

  • 2003-2004(2005)
    • qualifying rounds: compulsory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Heksai-dai, Yantsu, Tsuki-no-kata, Saiha, Heksai-sho
    • semi-final match for 3rd place, final: personal choice kata with Garyu, Seipai, Seienchin, Kanku, Susi-ho
    • Kata by personal choice should be different
  • 2005-2006
    • qualifying rounds: mandatory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu
    • Quarterfinals, Semifinals 3rd Place Match, Final: Personal Choice Kata from Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu, Saiha or Heksai-sho
    • Kata by personal choice should be different
  • 2007-2008
    • qualifying rounds: mandatory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Pinan sono 2-5
    • Quarterfinals, Semifinals, 3rd Place Match, Final: Personal Choice Kata with Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu
    • Kata by personal choice should be different

Rewarding

Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded with cups, diplomas and medals of the respective degrees.
